intro: Bidens bigelovii var. angustiloba, commonly known as narrowleaf beggarlice, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a hairy surface, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is often considered a weed but has ecological significance in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soils.
